headline: Starbucks Workers to Strike in 40 Cities, Targeting ‘Red Cup Day’
summary: Workers United, which represents staff at about 550 of Starbucks Corp.’s roughly 10,000 company-owned US cafes, plans to strike in at least 40 cities Thursday, including locations in New York City, Dallas, Minneapolis, Philadelphia and the company’s hometown of Seattle.  The protests are open-ended and could expand if there isn’t progress towards finalizing a union contract and resolving legal disputes.  The strike is pegged to Starbucks’ annual “Red Cup Day” promotion, when the company draws big crowds by giving away reusable holiday-themed cups.

content.title: Starbucks Workers to Strike in 40 Cities, Targeting ‘Red Cup Day’
content.summary: Workers United, which represents staff at about 550 of Starbucks Corp.’s roughly 10,000 company-owned US cafes, plans to strike in at least 40 cities Thursday, including locations in New York City, Dallas, Minneapolis, Philadelphia and the company’s hometown of Seattle.  The protests are open-ended and could expand if there isn’t progress towards finalizing a union contract and resolving legal disputes.  The strike is pegged to Starbucks’ annual “Red Cup Day” promotion, when the company draws big crowds by giving away reusable holiday-themed cups.

headline: Starbucks (SBUX) Is Up 5.3% After Ceding Majority Stake in China Unit to Boyu Capital—What's Changed
summary: Starbucks announced it will form a joint venture with Boyu Capital, giving Boyu up to 60% ownership of its US$4 billion-valued China retail business while Starbucks retains 40% and continues to license its brand and intellectual property. This collaboration reflects Starbucks' commitment to expanding in China alongside addressing significant shifts in delivery growth and evolving its store model amid ongoing labor relations challenges in the U.S. We'll examine how Starbucks' new partnership...

headline: Starbucks Workers to Strike in 40 cities, Targeting ‘Red Cup Day’
summary: Workers United, which represents staff at about 550 of Starbucks Corp.’s roughly 10,000 company-owned US cafes, plans to strike on Thursday in at least 40 cities, including New York, San Diego, Dallas, Philadelphia and the company’s hometown of Seattle.  The protests are open-ended and could expand if there isn’t progress towards finalizing a union contract and resolving legal disputes, according to the union.  The strike, involving more than 1,000 baristas at 65 cafes, is pegged to Starbucks’ annual “Red Cup Day” promotion, when the company draws big crowds by giving away reusable holiday-themed cups.

content.title: Starbucks Workers to Strike in 40 cities, Targeting ‘Red Cup Day’
content.summary: Workers United, which represents staff at about 550 of Starbucks Corp.’s roughly 10,000 company-owned US cafes, plans to strike on Thursday in at least 40 cities, including New York, San Diego, Dallas, Philadelphia and the company’s hometown of Seattle.  The protests are open-ended and could expand if there isn’t progress towards finalizing a union contract and resolving legal disputes, according to the union.  The strike, involving more than 1,000 baristas at 65 cafes, is pegged to Starbucks’ annual “Red Cup Day” promotion, when the company draws big crowds by giving away reusable holiday-themed cups.

headline: Starbucks’ Horrible Future
summary: Starbucks stock suggests the coffee purveyor’s best years are well behind it. The latest in a line of CEOs has failed to turn around Starbucks.

content.title: Starbucks’ Horrible Future
content.summary: Starbucks stock suggests the coffee purveyor’s best years are well behind it. The latest in a line of CEOs has failed to turn around Starbucks.
